details.summary: We work with the government of Malta on foreign policy issues like Syria, Iran, North Africa, and on domestic issues including health, justice and migration.
details.description:
We work to improve business links between our two countries and increase economic growth and employment.

We provide support to the large number of British citizens travelling to Malta and to British nationals who live here.
details.services:
Out-of-hours emergency assistance

British nationals who need emergency assistance outside normal office hours should call +356 2323 0000 where they will be given details on how to proceed.

Emergency travel documents

Information about how to get an emergency travel document if your UK passport is lost or stolen.

Passport renewal

For information on how to apply for your first passport or renew an existing passport, please visit the overseas passport section of this website.

Please note that the High Commission cannot deal with individual enquiries about passport applications. For all visa enquiries, please contact the Passport Advice Line.

Visas

For information on whether you require a visa for the United Kingdom and how to apply go to the UK Border Agency website

Please note that the High Commission cannot deal with individual enquiries about visa applications. For all visa enquiries, please contact the UK Border Agency.

Healthcare in Malta

Information for British nationals living, or planning to live, in Malta on the different ways to access healthcare.

Residency requirements

Information on applying for residency, including relevant forms and required documents, can be found on the website of the Department for Citizenship and Expatriate Affairs. EEA Nationals intending to reside in Malta for 3 months or more must register under one of the eResidence categories. Further details about applying for the new eResidence cards can be found here.

Registering a birth or death

Information on how you can register a birth or death which occurred overseas and on getting married or entering into a civil partnership overseas how to register births and deaths.

List of lawyers and interpreters

A list of English speaking lawyers and interpreters who may be able to help you with official transactions in Malta. Please note that inclusion in this list does not constitute official endorsement by the British High Commission or the UK government.

Travel Advice

Information, news and updates, listed country by country, to ensure you stay safe, avoid problems, and make informed decisions when living or travelling abroad.

How else we can help

In addition to the services listed above we can also:

  • provide information about transferring funds
  • provide appropriate help if you have suffered rape or serious assault, are a victim of other crime, or are in hospital
  • help people with mental illness
  • do all we properly can to contact you within 24 hours of being told that you have been detained
  • provide information about the legal and prison system for British nationals detained in Malta
  • offer support and help in a range of other cases, such as child abductions, death of relatives overseas, missing people and kidnapping
  • contact family or friends for you if you want
  • make special arrangements in cases of terrorism, civil disturbances or natural disasters

UK law says we have to charge for some services. Details of our current fees and the standards of service you can expect to receive are on display in all our consular offices.

What our consulates cannot do for you

Although we try to help British nationals in a wide range of situations, we cannot:

  • get you out of prison, prevent the local authorities from deporting you after your prison sentence, or interfere in criminal or civil court proceedings
  • help you enter a country, for example, if you do not have a visa or your passport is not valid, as we cannot interfere in another country’s immigration policy or procedures
  • give you legal advice, investigate crimes or carry out searches for missing people, although we can give you details of people who may be able to help you in these cases, such as English-speaking lawyers
  • get you better treatment in hospital or prison than is given to local people
  • pay any bills or give you money (in very exceptional circumstances we may lend you some money from public funds, which you will have to pay back)
  • make travel arrangements for you, or find you work or accommodation
  • make business arrangements on your behalf

details.access_and_opening_times:
The High Commission is located in Whitehall Mansions along the Seafront in Ta’ Xbiex.

For general enquiries please contact us between 0830 - 1200 and 1230 - 1500 Monday to Friday.

Consular Section is open to visitors from 0900 - 1300, Monday to Friday, except Wednesday (closed all day). Consular officers will accept phone calls for assistance to British Nationals from 0900 - 1500, Monday to Friday. Please note that our Reception and Consular staff cannot answer any passport or visa queries. Please visit the relevant websites for further information (follow the links on this page). For other queries not relating to passports or visas, please email us.

Access by public transport

Bus number 15, which runs between Valletta and Sliema, passes in front of the High Commission building in both directions.

Buses 13 and 14 will get you close to the High Commission when travelling from Sliema to Valletta. You will need to get off the bus in L-Abate Rigord Street, walk down the hill, turn to your left and keep walking until you reach Whitehall Mansions.

Visit the Arriva Malta website for further information on bus routes.

Parking

Ample parking is available in front of the High Commission.

Public holidays in 2013

  • Tuesday 1 January
  • Tuesday 19 March
  • Friday 29 March
  • Monday 1 April
  • Wednesday 1 May
  • Friday 7 June
  • Thursday 15 August
  • Monday 26 August
  • Friday 13 December
  • Monday 24 December
  • Wednesday 25 December
  • Thursday 26 December
  • Friday 27 December
  • Monday 30 December
  • Tuesday 31 December

To contact us in emergencies, out-of-hours and during office closures please call +356 2323 0000
